office: U.S. House of Representatives, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
requirements: attorney with several years of investigative or litigation experience
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage and direct a very busy constituent services office
plan, assign and evaluate the work of a team of 6 constituent services representatives
manage a portfolio of diverse city-wide and neighborhood events
stay on top of everyday events in the Member’s district
requirements: resident of the District of Columbia or willing to move immediately to DC if hired
salary: based on skill and experience level

requirements: minimum of 2 years of experience working for Congress
committed to the principles of constitutionally limited government and the free market

key_responsibilities: serve as a local representative for the member in defined geographic areas
manage casework within an assigned portfolio
monitor and update the Member and District Director on district and local issues
requirements: committed to the goals of the office and to improving the lives of the residents of the district

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent requests for information
planning and giving tours of the Capitol
assist the Communications Director with various press tasks
assisting the District Office staff with additional tasks
assisting constituents of the 38th Congressional District resolve problems with federal agencies or find the appropriate state or local contact for non-federal issues
requirements: ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
work cooperatively and courteously with others
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
knowledge of California state and federal government agencies and experience in customer service
Strong organizations skills; attention to detail
Good computer skills, including proficiency and experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
Strong communication, analytical, and organization skills; an ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds; impeccable customer service manners; and superior public speaking skills
thorough understanding of government agencies and structure
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
ability to meet strict deadlines, balance multiple projects simultaneously, and work under pressure
graduated from an accredited four-year college or university with a bachelor’s degree
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

key_responsibilities: generating ideas that yield media coverage
promoting the Member’s agenda through traditional and social media
serving as primary spokesperson for national and local media
managing coverage of legislative action and events
drafting statements, releases, speeches, opinion editorials and responses to articles
requirements: extensive media contacts and background working with both print and electronic media
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to work in a high pressure, team-oriented environment while juggling multiple tasks
significant Appropriations and Capitol Hill experience

office: Energy and Commerce Committee Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: preparation for committee hearings, markups, meetings and events
maintaining files, office supplies and equipment
assisting staff with research, work product, web content, special projects, and other duties as assigned
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: manage all aspects of constituent correspondence
processing incoming correspondence through Intranet Quorum (IQ)
meeting with constituents on policy matters
write floor speeches and committee statements
handle meetings with constituents and interest groups on behalf of Member
generating ideas that yield media coverage
promoting the Member’s agenda through traditional and social media
serving as primary spokesperson for national and local media
managing coverage of legislative action and events
drafting statements, releases, speeches, opinion editorials and responses to articles
requirements: extensive media contacts and background working with both print and electronic media
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to work in a high pressure, team-oriented environment while juggling multiple tasks

key_responsibilities: directly staffing the Congressman on the Appropriations Committee for defense, veterans, and foreign affairs policy issues
Several other policy areas would be included in legislative portfolio for this position
